mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, John Augustine Washington III to Jane C. Washington, 1842 February 26
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, John Augustine, III, 1821-1861
mdRecord.dcterms:description: John Augustine writes to his mother, who is in Charlestown, about ways of making more money at Mount Vernon, including erecting a tavern at the Gum Spring and allowing a steamboat company to run a ship to Mount Vernon for a fee. This will "avoid the inconvenience of a number of hacks, & having persons tampering with the servants." Autograph letter signed, 4 pages, with integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
